result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan A Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

2:23 PM Defendant Johnathan A Jacobs in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Johnathan A Jacobs.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for sentencing after pleas were entered 6/30/22.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
COUNT 1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

3   YEARS OF IMPRISONMENT (Credit  0 Days)
1.5    YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
1.5    YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Consecutive to:  any other sentence if revoked; 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

TERM ON PROBATION:  3 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*No use or possession of CBD products; 
*Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*Community Service - 40 Hours through Running Rebels in Milwaukee;
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license;

RESTITUTION:  $500 to Victim A;
COSTS:  $268     
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250     
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash on file to be applied to costs/fines/surcharges with any balance remaining to be refunded to the poster.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

*****************************************
COUNT 5: 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  9 MONTHS Days in the Waukesha County Jail 
1st 30 DAYS must be served as Straight-time. The balance to be served w/Huber (all standard release conditions, including release for attending school). Any good time calculation may not be applied to the 30 days of straight-time. **Corrected by the clerk per Judge Dorow 10/13/22.
4  Days Credit.
Concurrent to Count 6; 
Defendant is remanded into custody. 

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash on file to be applied to costs/fines/surcharges with any balance remaining to be refunded to the poster.

*****************************************
COUNT 6: 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

JAIL:  9 MONTHS Days in the Waukesha County Jail 
1st 30 DAYS must be served as Straight-time. The balance to be served w/Huber (all standard release conditions, including release for attending school). Any good time calculation may not be applied to the 30 days of straight-time. **Corrected by the clerk per Judge Dorow 10/13/22.
4  Days Credit.
Concurrent to Count 5; 
Defendant is remanded into custody. 

COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash on file to be applied to costs/fines/surcharges with any balance remaining to be refunded to the poster.

*Forfeiture of the firearm

**Court denies request for expungement as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense.

08:30 AM Defendant Johnathan A Jacobs in court with attorney Robert E Webb.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for a Plea Hearing.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1, 5, & 6.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 5, & 6.
Counts 2, 3, 4, & 7 are dismissed and read in.

The Defense is seeking a sentencing hearing in August.
The State states that the victim is seeking $500.00 in restitution. 
The Court will adjourn the matter for a sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle.   Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney in criminal, civil, or insurance matter.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.
